data.title: Fix is_node_being_edited() when not building tools
data.body:
Fixes #3213.
Superseded #3242.

data.title: Sprite Region Editor doesn't save states between sessions.
data.body: If you have a scene for a sprite setup, the sprite region editor always starts at a default state, (no grid, no snap, grid steps every 10px, zoom 1). So you need to set up the editor every time.

data.title: "Save Paths as Relative" should be ON by default
data.body:
I think this option should be turned on by default. Are there any issues with it? 
I don't see any downsides, and as a plus it would allow to little more easily share some scenes that were designed in mind to be small and independent parts of the main project.
Also I'm wondering is it save to turn this option on in the middle of the works on the project?
_Will mark this as 2.1 milestone since there will be some works to polish plugin system in this relase_

data.title: Raycast nodes don't take into account a rotation of a capsule collision shape
data.body:
_bugsquadedit: Some small video footage that explains it very well:_ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sH4BqLvXerU&feature=youtu.be 
_Additionally project made by @hormoz1 but simplified a little:_ https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/168251/godot/bugsquad/RayCapsuleProblem.7z 

---

Hello.
There is a problem that I think it is a bug in godot it is a little hard to explain but I will say example you have raycast object with ray to 0,-1,0 when you put it under a box shape it will detect a the collision but it will not detect a collision if you put it under a capsule shape(unless you put the raycast completely into the object or the ray to is (0,1,0) there is a project that you can download and see:
http://www.mediafire.com/download/8m503pg60zd3f2j/Fps.zip
In here the player won't fall because the gravity scale is 0.
You will see that the raycast 1 will detect collision with the T but the raycast 2 will not detect any collision with Player.

data.title: Fix compile error when tools=no
Fix uint compile error, #3228
Allow selecting multiple scenes or scripts in "Quick Open ..." for opening
data.body:
The ability to select multiple scenes or scripts in "Quick Open Scene" and "Quick Open Script" would help increase productivity.

Use cases:
- Open all your scripts at once
- Open all the scripts in a folder (since the scripts are sorted by name, this is easy)
- Open just 2-3 scripts, without using the menu 2-3 times

data.title: Fix typo
List of functions inside a GDScript file and fast access by click
data.body:
I think it would be a nice feature to add to the script editor.
It basically consists on a panel (that can be hidden/shown) aside the editor, listing all the functions by their name. A click on the function focuses the editor on this function.
An icon just before each function name could give a quick information, such as:
- is an inherited function
- is a standard GDScript redefined function (_ready, _process, _draw...)
- is a user function (others)
- is a function called by connect()
- ...

data.title: Add info about the node's virtuals in the code editor
data.body:
Forking this comment from @reduz in another issue: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/1737#issuecomment-98901693

> I was thinking of adding to the code editor a tab that is "virtuals" or
> "overridable" and it shows a list of methods you can override and an
> optional link to the help

I think it's a cool idea, so it's worth having its own issue to discuss and maybe implement.

data.title: define XUSER_MAX_COUNT if not present
data.body: Fixes #3218

data.title: Add a mechanism to GDScript to wait for signal's completion
data.body:
This is feature request, and follows from the discussion in the issue #3223.

In GDScript, currently, there is no way to wait/block until a signal completes (in a general setting). This is in particular desirable in situations where the user wants to keep the game logic is synchronous, and the code structure flat (rather than sorting to a callback/futures/promises style game logic, which can be harder to develop and maintain).

It can be realized by adding a blocking alternative of signal-yield which blocks/waits until the signal is handled completely, or adding a `blocking=false` parameter to signal variant of yield for example.

data.title: Allow to use constants in preload/load
data.body:
Currently it's impossible to write code like that:

```
const PATH_2_SCENE = "ScenePath.xscn";
var scene = preload(PATH_2_SCENE);
```

In editor validation (before starting the program) It says `"error(9,22): Expected string constant as 'preload' argument"`
It would be nice to allow developers to use static const variables in case together with preloads and loads since it would ease changes if there would be ability to define paths in one place for the whole project.

data.title: Fix project settings add new category option
data.body:
Fixed project settings dialog add new category option, and fixes property delete option.

Closes #3177.

data.title: Better collada exporter support for multiple armatures
data.body:
An animated asset with more than one armature is not supported. So this is a request that a future version will support multiple armatures.
The following image is an example of an animated character where only one animation will be exported to the collada file. The red box indicates the animation that wont be exported.
![colladaexporter-02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/12088680/b8a705fa-b2dd-11e5-94d7-e67d46399b2c.png)
Exporting using the Better Collada plugin results in this warning message. 
The second warning is not relevant so just ignore it.
![colladaexporter-01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/12087806/46285580-b2d6-11e5-9c77-6584a5eb3e8e.png)
I did not make the asset myself by the way, it was purchased.

data.title: "Orphan Resource Manager" should be converted into "Resource Manager" with "show orphans only" option
data.body:
I'm not sure why there is no 'Resource Manager' tool, it should work very similar to how Orphan Resource Manager works but should also allow to check dependencies for scenes that are not orphans. I mean, it's currently impossible to quickly check where given scene is used. 
Also in this case I would suggest to change name from "Resources Manager" to **Dependencies Manager**.

data.title: Remove unnecessary null pointer checks
data.body: Removing useless non-null pointer checks before using `delete` and `delete[]` (see issue #55)

data.title: Orphan resource explorer should start with all folders folded
data.body:
I think all folders and subfolders should be folded by default. It's quite difficult to find one particular file in bigger project currently, the first thing I usually do is to fold all the folders and only then I'm able to navigate the project normally. Gif, just to make sure I'm understated correctly:
![foldfolders](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6129594/12088116/b7a17230-b2d8-11e5-9cf4-529e43475cdd.gif)

data.title: Windows 10 / Visual Studio 2015 compilation error
data.body:
Using commit https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/30d4a50b424c927b178cabfe30302de1e9d4c836, I get a compilation error when building using Windows 10 64-bit using Visual Studio 2015 (compiling to 32 bits).

```
drivers\jpegd\image_loader_jpegd.cpp(66): error C2065: 'uint': undeclared identifier
drivers\jpegd\image_loader_jpegd.cpp(66): error C2146: syntax error: missing ';' before identifier 'scan_line_len'
drivers\jpegd\image_loader_jpegd.cpp(66): error C2065: 'scan_line_len': undeclared identifier
drivers\jpegd\image_loader_jpegd.cpp(67): error C2065: 'scan_line_len': undeclared identifier
```

data.title: tileset overwriting doesn't refresh the spritelist.
data.body:
If you save a tileset overwriting the old one, tilemap editor doesn't reflect changes until you exit and enter godot.

Overwriting the tileset without merging should refresh on the fly too. It's better than "Merge with existing" to keep the tilemap updated and organized.

data.title: using POSITION in frag shader causes GLSL compiler error
data.body:
In a 3D fragment shader, when trying to use the POSITION variable, I get this error: 

ERROR: get_current_version: MaterialShaderGLES2: Program LINK FAILED:
Fragment info
-------------
0(846) : error C5052: gl_Position is not accessible in this profile
I believe this is because gl_Position is only meant to be used as the output of the vertex shader, not the input to the fragment shader. In the fragment shader, the position is available in gl_FragCoord.

data.title: Hotkey for disabling snapping
data.body:
Sometimes is desirable to disable pixel/grid snapping for a few seconds.
I think there should be a quick key to do that.

When moving the node: press ALT
When scaling the node: press CTRL
When rotating the node: press ALT

data.title: Uniformly scaling nodes with aspect != 1:1
data.body:
Scaling nodes using the SHIFT key to scale uniformly (keeping aspect) works right only when the node has an aspect of 1:1

When scaling with another aspect the node stretches in a non uniform way.
This issue is an oldie but I guess nobody reported it yet.

data.title: Allow a way to block until a signal is emitted
data.body:
I asked about this in the forums but I couldn't get an answer. I think maybe there is no way to do this currently in godot. I hope it's OK to make an issue about this.

In the [documentation](http://www.godotengine.org/projects/godot-engine/wiki/GDScript#Coroutines-38-Signals), it says:

> The real strength of using yield is when combined with signals. yield can accept two parameters, an object and a signal. When the signal is activated, execution will return.

But this works only if you call yield in a "top-level" function in the GDScript call stack. For example, if I use yield as follows, it doesn't block:

```
# script of the class

var m_param

# return a result from a signal
func get_result():
    # stuff...
    yield(node, "signal")
    # more stuff here...
    return m_param

func signal_callback(param):
    m_param = param
```

When I make an instance of this class and call get_result as follows:

```
# stuff
var result = obj.get_result()
```

it gives me a `GDFunctionState`, not `m_param`.

This is useful for getting input from the user via an input from a GUI control object for example.

I'm not sure if this is a bug in the implementation or the intended behavior but it's a bit confusing. Maybe the docs should be updated to clarify that yield doesn't actually block.

That being said, a blocking alternative to yield is sorely need for the use case I mentioned above.

data.title: Add "Make Resource Unique" flag (allow unique Materials on instanced nodes)
data.body:
_bugsquad edit:  The orginal title of this issue was "Shader material not unique on instanced nodes"_
_Changed title to reflect "feature proposal" status in reaction to reduz comment: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3222#issuecomment-168666945_

---

Related to #2162

When using shader on sprites (haven tested on other nodes), the shader is the same for every instanced sprite.
I have a setup where the sprites are instanced in the editor inside another scene. If the shader changes one of it's parameters it changes on every sprite instance.

RootNode
===> Instanced1
=====> Sprite(shader)
===> Instanced2
======> Sprite(shader)

This happens even if I use the "Make sub-resources unique" on the instanced node. The only way to achive this is going node by node and set the "Editable Children" flag to true. Then navigating to the sprite child node and setting "Make sub-resources unique" flag.

Is there a reason why the shader resources are not duplicated when duplicating nodes that are using them?

PS: here's a test project https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/274954519/godot-issues/test_shaders.zip

data.title: Range subclasses (Slider, Spinbox...) can return -0
data.body:
As mentioned in #3091, apparently due to a rounding error, nodes like ?Slider and SpinBox can return -0 if the min value is negative and rounded values is enabled.
This is a minor issue, since Godot recognizes (0 == -0) as true, but when converting to string, the sign will be preserved, which can lead to some minor awkwardness that would have to be addressed manually.

data.title: Environment of the camera can't be loaded from disk
data.body: Just like the title says if one saves environment of the camera to the disk it doesnt work, changed values doesnt do nothing on camera viewport environment only works by assigninig new via function "New Environment" on camera.

data.title: Disable renaming SpriteFrames
data.body: Renaming SpriteFrames is just visual, since the name will always be _Frame #_. Allowing to rename them is confusing.
